definitions.definition: A conversation or other form of discourse between two or more individuals.
examples: Melinda and Bill maintained a dialogue via email over the course of their long-distance relationship.

definitions.definition: In a dramatic or literary presentation, the verbal parts of the script or text; the verbalizations of the actors or characters.
examples: The movie had great special effects, but the dialogue was lackluster.

definitions.definition: A literary form, where the presentation resembles a conversation.
examples: A literary historian, she specialized in the dialogues of ancient Greek philosophers.
Once the My Computer dialogue opens, select Local Disk (C:), then right click and scroll down.

main_definition: A conversation or other form of discourse between two or more individuals.
secondary_definitions: ( authorship ) In a dramatic or literary presentation, the verbal parts of the script or text; the verbalizations of the actors or characters.
( philosophy ) A literary form, where the presentation resembles a conversation.
( computing , nonstandard ) Nonstandard form of dialog .
